intro: [WRONG START] Erysimony buschii, commonly known as the Busch's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual or biennial plant that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Its flowers are bright yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Erysimum buschii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
